page.title: 02The Quaker Settlement 1700-
page.content: One of the most interesting features of the area is The Quaker Settlement at High Flats. It is possible to miss this historic settlement as you travel along the main road to Huddersfield as it is tucked down a small road. The site was founded by Jonh Firth of Shepley, who was a follower of George Fox; the founder of the quaker religion. The Quaker Meeting House is where all the quakers used to meet. Next to the meeting house is the burial ground which is still used to this day by the quakers. The earliest grave is about 1660 and the latest grave is 1982. The quakers real name is the Society of Friends. They got their name the quakers because they said "quake and tremble at the name of thy lord".
